author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Chief Educational Officer (CEO), Vellore has suspended a social science teacher for misbehaving with a Class X girl student of Government Higher Secondary School, Madhanur.

Officials of the Education Department said relatives of the student and villagers’ gheraoed the school on February 13 to protest against the PG teacher, S. Raji. They had alleged that he was misbehaving with the student and sought action against him.

"Following the protest, the District Education Officer (DEO) of Tirupattur was asked to conduct an inquiry on their complaint that the teacher was behaving with a student. Preliminary inquiry found the complaint to be true," said an official.

Following a report on the preliminary finding, CEO, Vellore R. Bhoopathy placed the teacher on suspension on under section 17 (e) of Tamil Nadu Civil Services (Discipline and Appeal) Rules.

"Teachers have to be role models to students. The decision to suspend him was based on the preliminary finding in the DEO’s inquiry. We will be framing charges against him and initiate departmental action on him," he said.
title: Teacher suspended for misbehaving with student
